nodes.text: Beytolim was a Pacithhip who, in the year 19 BBY, was present outside the Galaxies Opera House on the planet Coruscant while it hosted a performance of the Mon Calamari ballet Squid Lake. As the Jedi Knight Anakin Skywalker ran into the opera house to meet Supreme Chancellor Sheev Palpatine inside, Beytolim was walking with two other Pacithhip up the opera house's steps. Beytolim had blue eyes and green skin and wore a fur cloak with a spotted pattern to the opera house.

Beytolim's costume was first used during the filming of the 2002 prequel trilogy film, Star Wars: Episode II Attack of the Clones, where an extra wore it during the scenes set in the Outlander Club and its surroundings. However, Beytolim is not visible in the final film and did not make an appearance until the 2005 prequel trilogy film, Star Wars: Episode III Revenge of the Sith.

The Revenge of the Sith opera steps scene was filmed on R Stage at Shepperton Studios as part of additional photography on Monday, August 23, 2004. The Pacithhip did not receive a name in the film, but was identified in the 2017 reference book Star Wars: The Visual Encyclopedia, which was written by Adam Bray, Tricia Barr and Cole Horton.
